humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that there is a first tumor of poorly differentiated invasive ductal carcinoma with a tumor diameter of 2.8 cm. Based on the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the size of the largest tumor focus is 2.8 cm, which falls in the T2 category (tumor size 2.0-5.0 cm). Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
